{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3471007,"name":"Kevin ","username":"kr1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kr1699/{size}/207533_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-05T17:24:53.362Z","cooked":"

We’re trying to use the CTRE swerve generator and yesterday we had to downgrade all of our firmware and rio image and the vendor library to 2024 in order to be compatible with the code generated by Phoenix Tuner X. It looks to still be using the 2024 swerve library. From what I’ve read people have been using the Preview app to generate 2025 code, but it tells us it’s not available for the 2025 season when we open it. I’ve tried uninstalling and reinstalling both apps several times. Am I missing a release somewhere that isn’t on the microsoft store? Is the PC bugging and not showing the update? Or are we in some unlucky window where the 2025 app is not available yet? I don’t want to move forward with pathplanner and tuning and such before we are able to use the 2025 library.

tl;dr swerve code generated by phoenix tuner is from 2024, how do we get access to a tuner version compatible with 2025

2025 Tuner is not available quite yet. It should be up in the next few days.

Well what we did is download the 2025 Tuner Preview directly from the microsoft store, and when you open it, it shows a pop-up saying that you should use the normal version, we just clicked on another part of the window within the app, and we were able to use it

Note that, as the popup states, the Tuner X Preview’s Swerve Project Generator (and other features) is not compatible with changes in our kickoff API, nor the kickoff roboRIO image and WPILib. You can check out our SwerveWithPathPlanner or SwerveWithChoreo example until the stable 2025 Tuner X release is available.

Looks like the update just got processed. You should be able to restart the Microsoft Store to see the update. If for some reason it doesn’t work, try resetting the Microsoft Store by

  • Windows Key + R
  • Type wsreset.exe

in simulation periodic you need to be running something like m_robotContainer.m_swerve.simulationPeriodic();
im not sure if the generated example has it, but their path planner example doesnt.

maple-sim also just added support for ctre, though it is more complex

Maple-sim Alpha: Bringing Robot Simulations to the Next Level with Physics Engines Programming
CTRE Generated Swerve Project with Maple-Sim - Finally Here! This work is inspired by and based on Team 5104 “The Breakerbots”'s Custom Library - BreakerLib. Thank you, @Roman-Tech-Plus, for your creativity and generosity!
Why did it take so long?We started in late November, so you might wonder why we're only releasing it now in January. Alright, I'll admit it—one big reason was my laziness (LMAO). We also ran into technical challenges with internal bugs in PhoenixLib, wh…

Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T01:40:11.482Z","cooked":"

Our generated swerve project and SwerveWithPathPlanner example both run simulation code in a separate 5ms Notifier out-of-the-box (link).

BirdyBird:

We’re using the swerve generated project but simulation doesn’t work. Nothing shows up.
Did this happen to any of you?

What language are you using? How are you running simulation? And what do you mean by “nothing shows up”?

If you’re not seeing any simulation window at all, then you should follow WPILib’s documentation to make sure you’re launching simulation correctly.
In Python, you can use py -m robotpy sim. Otherwise, in Java and C++ you can press Ctrl+Shift+P and run the “WPILib: Simulate Robot Code” command.
